intro: Anemonidium tetrasepalum, commonly known as the four-lobed anemonidium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes buttercups and other similar plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers with four sepals. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
